entries.title: Multiple updates and deployment activities
entries.whats_new: The project has undergone various updates including main.py updates, changelog modifications, and deployment on Railway. Several merge operations and requirements file updates were performed, along with API testing and environment setup.
entries.impact: These changes improve the application's stability, deploy capabilities, and configuration options without affecting user workflows directly.

entries.title: OpenAI LLM configuration now customizable
entries.whats_new: Users can now configure their own Git repository, OpenAI language model, API key, and other settings.
entries.breaking_change: Because it modifies how users set up the application and introduces customizable parameters, existing configurations might become incompatible if not updated accordingly.

entries.title: Interface management and front-end polish
entries.whats_new: Interfaces were consolidated into a single file for easier management. The front-end home page was decorated with loading effects, and code cleanup was performed. The changelog detail page was implemented with the ability to navigate to specific entries.
entries.breaking_change: Yes. Navigating to a specific changelog entry now directs users to detailed logs, a change from previous behavior.
entries.impact: Users will experience improved navigation and clarity when viewing changelog details, but existing links or integrations may need to be updated.

entries.title: Front-end layout and cache strategy update
entries.whats_new: Implemented a JSON cache strategy to connect front-end and back-end, with cache generation on the server and loading on the client. Layout content was centered, and the icon was changed to Greptile. The sidebar and overview pages were polished.
entries.breaking_change: The new cache mechanism alters how data is fetched and displayed, which may require updates to existing front-end integrations. Layout and icon changes may also affect user interface consistency.

entries.title: Web interface and user experience enhancements
entries.whats_new: A sidebar was built for navigation, and the front-end web face was created to display autogenerated changelogs from GitHub, highlighting date, news, impact, and potential breaking changes.
entries.breaking_change: Yes. The introduction of a web interface that automatically summarizes changelog entries and highlights breaking changes constitutes a major update.
entries.impact: This allows users to view changelogs easily through a web interface, with automatic detection of breaking changes, significantly improving user experience but possibly requiring adjustments for existing integrations.

entries.title: Backend features and initial setup
entries.whats_new: The backend API was implemented, and the application was initialized with support for adding titles, details, breaking changes, impact, and related changes to entries. The second version of the LLM was introduced, with support for deletion of cache and automatic detection of breaking changes.
entries.impact: These backend changes enhance the application's ability to generate detailed changelogs and detect breaking changes automatically, improving functionality without disrupting existing workflows.
